name: NSWorkspace.LaunchConfigurationKey
desc: The following keys can be used in the configuration dictionary of the launchApplication(at:options:configuration:) method.  Each key is optional, and if omitted, default behavior is applied.DeprecatedUse NSWorkspace.OpenConfiguration instead.

items.name: static let appleEvent: NSWorkspace.LaunchConfigurationKey
items.desc: The value is the first NSAppleEventDescriptor to send to the new app. If an instance of the app is already running, this is sent to that app.

items.name: static let architecture: NSWorkspace.LaunchConfigurationKey
items.desc: The value is an NSNumber containing an Mach-O Architecture constant. Ignored if a new instance of the app is not launched.

items.name: static let arguments: NSWorkspace.LaunchConfigurationKey
items.desc: The value is an NSArray of NSStrings, passed to the new app in the argv parameter. Ignored if a new instance of the app is not launched. This constant is not available to sandboxed apps.

items.name: static let environment: NSWorkspace.LaunchConfigurationKey
items.desc: The value is an NSDictionary, mapping NSStrings to NSStrings, containing environment variables to set for the new app. Ignored if a new instance of the app is not launched. This constant is not available to sandboxed apps.
